title: Add final teddy jump animation with Yes/No choice at the end

requirements.text: Update the final section of the Valentine experience (the Closing section) to include a visible teddy that performs a looping “jump” animation.

quotes: At the last will be my valentine teady jump animation

acceptanceCriteria: When the user reaches the last/closing section, a teddy graphic is displayed prominently.
The teddy has a continuous jump/bounce animation (and respects prefers-reduced-motion by reducing/disabling the animation).
The teddy renders correctly in both light and dark themes without visual glitches.

requirements.text: Add two final choice buttons in the Closing section: “Yes” and “No”. On “Yes”, show the confirmation message: "I love you, wife garu". On “No”, show a playful prompt that tells the user to click Yes (in English).

quotes: and two options if it click yes I love you wife garu if it click no mean go and click yes these options

acceptanceCriteria: The Closing section includes two clearly labeled buttons: “Yes” and “No”.
Clicking “Yes” displays exactly: "I love you, wife garu" (English text).
Clicking “No” displays an English message that instructs the user to click “Yes” (e.g., "No means: go and click Yes.") without navigating away or breaking the flow.

The existing Closing section actions (“Back to Top”, “Replay Surprise”) remain available and continue working as before (either retained alongside the new buttons or reorganized without loss of functionality).

requirements.text: Add the generated teddy image asset to the frontend as a static file and use it in the Closing section (do not serve it from the backend).
acceptanceCriteria: A teddy image file exists under frontend/public/assets/generated and is referenced by the Closing section via a /assets/generated/... path.
The app builds successfully and the teddy image loads without 404s in the browser.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or the immutable hook paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep all backend logic (if any is added later) within the single Motoko actor at backend/main.mo; no additional backend services.
nonGoals: Adding or changing Internet Identity authentication flows.
Adding backend persistence or any canister-based storage for the Yes/No outcome.
